content.description: awkward but good rock and fun movement.
content.protection: singles .2 through 4, one or two #6's, preferably 7's.
content.location: Right most crack of x,y,z crack trifecta. Up OW crack then hand crack to top.

content.description: Middle crack of the x,y,z crack trifecta.
content.protection: 4's and 5's

content.description: Left crack of short face split by 3 wide cracks.
content.protection: 4's and 5's

content.description: Getting through the thin crack up high is difficult. We aided it but it would go free with hard tips and fingers. The first part of route to a pod is not too difficult; center very difficult then the last third of route where it goes left on a rail is exposed and has some brittle rock next to great rock (pro is solid).
content.protection:
Double C3s, sm-med nuts, double #.5 to #2 

  Bolted anchor/single 60m
content.location: Just upstream and same side as Anti crag routes. Wander up left side of wall forming the tower; starts on easy slab (4th class) then easy 5th at a chimney to tree belay. Steep 4th to shoulder/ledge with tower on it. Climb north face of tower. Rap bolts get you below the ledge to top of chimney. Rap off tree to ground.

content.description: Work up to the top of the ledge with micro gear; the moves here aren't hard but the micro gear placement may get you a little heady (PG-13 but not hard). Once on the ledge, make a boulder move, which can feel harder than 5.9 (depending on how you piece it together) to get established in the crack systems. Follow the fingers to broken rock seam up to ledge, followed by an excellent fingers finish. If the chunky rock in the middle section gives you strife, you can easily reach left and place "bomber" hand sized protection in the hands crack of Moonwalk. Shares two bolt anchor with Moonwalk - on top ledge, to the left when finishing.
content.protection: Micros/nuts for start   Single - 2 & 3    Doubles - .2-.3 & .5-1   Triple or Quad - .4   Slings
content.location: Far right side of Anti-Crag. Just right of Symmetry, Line Dance, and Moonwalk.

content.description: Obvious beautiful splitter crack on right portion of crag. Wonderful pure crack climbing.
content.protection: one .75, one #1, two #2, two #3, two #4, one 4.5 and one #5. It doesn't look that big up higher but it is. Rap down.
content.location: Can't miss it, walk past chicken fingers and 25 feet diff eq. and look up.

content.description: 25 ft to the right of battle axe and 50 feet left of Chicken fingers is a featured wall, you'll see it there. Great rock, mixture of horizontal seams/rails and intermittent shallow finger cracks. crux getting to 3rd bolt but quite consistent at grade.
content.protection: bring 5 quick draws, ends at anchor.

climbs.name: Rabid Snake
climbs.fa: M. Rangel, S. Twieto, B. Obermann, L. Wilkerson

content.description: This is a crack in center of wall, from wide fingers to chimney. Starts on easy crack to wide roof. Step on the mass of the roofs lips above, not on the edge.
content.protection: med nuts, single rack of cams to #6 camalot (double #3 for finish).
content.location: When you reach the spring on the left/south bank, cross to the north side and look for a wall with a crack in center. Starts wide fingers and quickly widens to squeeze roof finish.

climbs.name: Old Grey Mare
climbs.fa: Scott D, Aaron C, Nate Y.

content.description: Take a ride on the old grey mare, but don't take her for granted, she still has a lot of kick: Starts below, just slightly left of arête up easy section to first bolt, then commit to moving right and using arête and features on face right of arête. Sweet, thin and balanced moves lead along arête then to crux 5th bolt and rest ledge then sweet bulge with juggy,exposed finish. Great route, fun the whole way.
content.protection: sport, chains on top.
content.location: Left of Sweet Singularity and Heckle and Jive, starts below obvious arête.

content.description: Work up to the top of the ledge with micro gear; the moves here aren't hard but the micro gear placement may get you a little heady (PG-13 but not hard). Once on the ledge, make a boulder move, which can feel harder than 5.9 (depending on how you piece it together) to get established in the crack systems. Work up and into the great hands crack to the left. Follow it up through the squeeze exit to a two bolt anchor with chains above a ledge to the right. Don't miss the nice seam in the back of the squeeze for good finishing protection.
content.protection: A few micros/nuts for start   Singles - .2-.75   Doubles - 1-3   Slings
content.location: Far right side of Anti-Crag. Just right of Symmetry and Line Dance.

content.description: Stem past the first Bombay to reach a stance below a second Bombay corner. Tackle this short squeeze before ramping up twin seams with stemming to another resting stance. An overhanging hand crack trends left into a finishing chimney. Deceivingly good!
content.protection: Doubles for #.4-#3 with emphasis on the #.5-#.75. Lots of runners. Anchor.
content.location: At the right side of the Anti-Crag, appx. ten feet right of Symmetry. A small rock landing marks the base of this obvious ramp/hallway route. A hard to see anchor is placed at the top left of the system.

content.description: P1: easy start on good pro to awkward short chimney to ledge and first bolt. Go up chimney/arete on chossy rock but easy climbing and bolts to anchor.   P2: Past 2 bolts angled traverse past low angled slab to dark black open book. The book is the crux pull buldge to top. Descent is rap from top if 70 meter rope can reach P2 belay, if not go to one of bolts on P2 then short rap to anchors and a 3rd rap to ground.
content.protection: Small to #5 cams single set, 5 quickdraws and one or two extenders.
content.location: To the right of DE about 15 feet.

content.description: Just right of Sweet singularity. Crux is first two bolts. Steep start, trick is sorting out multitude of holds for the best ones. Surprisingly good rock for the area. First half steep and sporty, second half fun 5.9+ trad on good rock.
content.protection: 3 QD's then set of nuts and light rack of a few cams to choose from in the .3 to .75 range. bring 2 or 3 extendable runners just in case you like to wander.

content.description: Start rattley fingers with insecure movement, crux in first 10 feet, then gradually gets easier. Good pro.
content.protection: Triples bd .75 and .5, singles .3, 1, 2, 3
content.location: Just to left of Battle axe and approx 35 feet right of asymmetry starts a finger crack that gets a little thinner then finishes in easy chimney.

content.description: Starts nice crack then into thin 15 ft chimney. Chimney is a lot of work, especially if you are big. Good pro in the bag of the chimney then pull bulge and continue on nice fingers, tight hands to top. Rap off.
content.protection: Small to large cams, nuts. triples or quads in the .75 size.
content.location: Right around the corner from chicken fingers - past the first steep crack. Look for a very narrow chimney about 20 feet above.

content.description: Obvious dihedral on left portion of wall. split by thin crack, beautiful line on good rock. thin fingers and stemming. most of climb is 10+, crux is 5 feet of bouldery movement that you can aid through by using the bolt at the crux if necessary.
content.protection: small to medium nuts. doubles cams smallest through .75 and singles #1 through #4. three bolts

content.description: Angling fist crack to start, into awkward pod then finish on flake. A bit loose on top. Fun route
content.protection: one of: .5, .75, 1, 2, 3, and two 4's. 2 bolt anchor on top.
content.location: Just right of the x,y,z crack trifecta on the facing wall.

climbs.name: Belly Beans
climbs.fa: Scott Duemler, Michael Genovese FA, FFA Aaron Peterson 8/21

content.description: Crux is pulling over steep start. Fun route, good pro.
content.protection: Singles .3 to 3
content.location: Right of hump crack, left of asymmetry.

content.description: Between chicken fingers and asymmetry is a mostly moss covered wall. This line goes up a mostly clean crack up and right into a large flake. start is bouldery with smeary feet and insecure hand to place first piece. after that easier, a little sand but will clean up. a fun, short warm up for the area. the flake is good fun and easier than it looks with a juggy finish. Rap off.
content.protection: light rack to #4 with doubles in #2,#3

climbs.name: Bat Ass Crack
climbs.fa: David Bloom, Tim Roley, Scott Duemler

content.description: Around the corner right from chicken fingers but before DE is an overhung jagged crack going to a roof. Strenuous, very good rock. If you want to finish just below the roof, the rating goes at 11a and there is a single bolt which you can back up with a bomber nut to TR. Climbing past roof is the really serious part at solid 5.12: Fingers and crimps over roof. Rap off.
content.protection: triples .3 through.75, doubles #1.

content.description: Starts on ledge, angles right then straight up convoluted but well protected crack.
content.protection: singles .4 to 5. two bolt anchor on top.
content.location: walk left of chicken fingers about 80 feet along walls

content.description: Thin, balancy sequences of crimps up good rock. Continuos, requires some endurance.
content.protection: Bolts to 2 bolt anchor.

content.description: A collection of stellar crack climbs, some with a few bolts. These were all done ground up. Rock quality is good, scenery is superb.
